description:
The definition of to_xml in nova/virt/libvirt_conn.py is:

def to_xml(self, instance, rescue=False, network_info=None):

However in spawn(), it's passing network_info to rescue:

def spawn(self, instance, network_info=None):
    xml = self.to_xml(instance, network_info)

It could be fixed like:
xml = self.to_xml(instance, False, network_info)
or 
xml = self.to_xml(instance, network_info=network_info)
title: Parameter mismatch when calling to_xml() from spawn() in libvirt_conn.py

comments.content:
The definition of to_xml in nova/virt/libvirt_conn.py is:

def to_xml(self, instance, rescue=False, network_info=None):

However in spawn(), it's passing network_info to rescue:

def spawn(self, instance, network_info=None):
    xml = self.to_xml(instance, network_info)

It could be fixed like:
xml = self.to_xml(instance, False, network_info)
or 
xml = self.to_xml(instance, network_info=network_info)

comments.content: What are the ramifactions of this bug?  Is it causing reproducible failures?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content: Not really, but I encountered this problem when implementing boot from volume (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/boot-from-volume) by extending to_xml to accept another parameter. It was producing error and I realized that the parameter order was wrongly shifted because of this.
